job.title: Software Engineer, New Graduate
job.industry: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing,Information Technology and Services,Mechanical or Industrial Engineering
job.description: SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on MarsbrbrstrongSOFTWARE ENGINEER NEW GRADUATEbrbrstrongAre you a computer sciencecomputer engineering student graduating in fall 2021 or summer 2022 looking for fulltime employment after graduation Software engineers at SpaceX develop the code that can launch rockets and spacecraft optimize a satellite constellation capable of delivering internet almost anywhere on earth or allow us to manufacture advanced hardware quickly and reliably You will get the opportunity to work on everything from largescale web applications to tiny embedded computing platforms You will build tech stacks on CMVC4EFMSSQL via REST to JavascriptKnockoutHandlebarsLESS CEmbedded Linux Python LabVIEW which all together enables us to build launch and monitor some of the worlds most advanced technologiesbrbrFulltime employment is available with a variety of engineering teams across all company programs including Dragon Falcon Satellites Starlink and Starship at Brownsville TX Cape Canaveral FL Hawthorne Los Angeles CA McGregor Waco TX and Redmond Seattle WA No matter the team or program you will come in and make an impact right away working on creative solutions to real aerospace challengesbrbrstrongRESPONSIBILITIESbrstrongulliDevelop highly reliable and available software systemsliliParticipate in architecture design and code reviewsliliDevelop prototypes to prove out key design concepts and quantify technical constraintsliliCollaborate with other engineers to plan and organize the development of our productsliliOwn all aspects of software engineering and product developmentbrliulstrongBASIC QUALIFICATIONSbrstrongulliBachelors degree in computer science engineering physics math or science disciplineliliDevelopment experience in an objectoriented programming language ie C C Python NetbrliulstrongPREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEbrstrongulliDeveloped debugged and deployed software that has been used in real world applicationsprojectsliliCreative approach to problem solving exceptional analytical skills and engineering fundamentalsliliStrong skills in debugging performance optimization and unit testingliliExcellent communication skills both written and verballiliAbility to work effectively in a dynamic environment with changing needs and requirementsliliDeep understanding of testing continuous integration build deployment amp continuous monitoringliliFull stack development experiencebrliulstrongADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTSbrstrongulliExtended hours and weekend work may be required to support critical project and mission milestonesbrliulstrongITAR REQUIREMENTSbrstrongulliTo conform to US Government space technology export regulations including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations ITAR you must be a US citizen lawful permanent resident of the US protected individual as defined by 8 USC 1324ba3 or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the US Department of State Learn more about the ITAR here brliulSpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race color religion gender national originethnicity veteran status disability status age sexual orientation gender identity marital status mental or physical disability or any other legally protected statusbrbrApplicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceXs Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the applicationinterview process should notify the Human Resources Department at 310 3636000
